channel.title: [317 - DELTA] Custom Interfaces requiring money [Rep++]

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Custom Interfaces requiring money [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Smokey2 Smokey_
item.description:
@Smokey2 wrote:

With the methods and statements you have there, and guessing by the naming doesn’t the c.playerHasItem(int, int) method return a boolean value?

If so, you could just do:

case 38253: if(c.playerHasItem(995, 2000000000)) { c.deleteItem(995, c.getItemSlot(995), 2000000000); c.addItem(455, 1); c.sM("You recieve a @red@financial statement card@bla@ worth 2B GP."); } break;

Basically you had the right idea, except you were missing the if block, and if you don’t have an if block that method is being assigned to nothing

Read full topic

item.title: [317 - DELTA] Custom Interfaces requiring money [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

Okay so I’ve made some more custom interfaces.

I made a shop where players can exchange their max cash for a 2b item (same as max cash)

This is the case for my clickingmost.java file

case 38253: c.playerHasItem(995, 2000000000); c.deleteItem(995, c.getItemSlot(995), 2000000000); c.addItem(455, 1); c.sM("You recieve a @red@financial statement card@bla@ worth 2B GP."); break;

The only problem is it doesn’t look for cash, or delete it. It just gives the item out for free. Any ideas on how to make it require cash?

Read full topic
